- Chelicerae without anterior tooth ( Fig. 57D )..................................................
G . patriceae
n. sp.

7 Chelicerae with two posterior bulges ( Fig. 20E ).................................................
G. lacteovittata

8 Cheliceral posterior bulge located at the level of the Ret2 and Ret3, as seen in mesal view ( Fig. 10F ).....
G. boraceia
n. sp.

- Cheliceral posterior bulge located at the level of the Ret3 and Ret4, as seen in mesal view ( Fig. 15F ).......
G . florezi
n. sp.

10 Spermathecae and copulatory ducts well-developed ( Figs. 125A–E )......................................
G. minuta

- Spermathecae and copulatory ducts reduced ( Figs. 129A–E )..........................................
G. emertoni
11 Carapace with pore-bearing and setae-bearing lateral depressions ( Figs. 31E , 37D–E , 38E )......................... 12

13 Membranous chamber with filiform projections ( Fig. 41A )............................................
G. dentata

- Membranous chamber without such projections (
Figs. 36 A , G
).....................................
G. argyrostilba

14 Chelicerae with a strong macrosetae ( Fig. 85H ).................................................
G. hirsutissima

19 Cheliceral fang outgrowth well-developed ( Fig. 90E )....................................................
G. foxi

21 Chelicera with posterior bulge; Ret2 enlarged ( Figs. 106E )...........................................
G. spherella

22 Chelicerae with 3 promarginal and 3 retromarginal teeth ( Fig. 72F )................................
G . caaguara
n. sp.

- Chelicerae with 3 promarginal and 4 retromarginal teeth ( Fig. 94F )......................................
G. heleios
